file_content.text: No, I'll buy a moon. Moons are so much more poetic.
A little bird tells me you've taken care of those cameras. You should know certain... parties wagered on you failing.
I, of course, took the smart bet. But my conscience insists I give you a share of the winnings.
Much appreciated.
I'm sure there's a military hospital somewhere that could use some charity.
You should donate the rest.
Ah, yes--not to mention the tax benefits involved.
Don't hold out on me, Vrish.
What a fast learner. Very well, hopefully this will suffice.
Who's betting that I'd fail?
I want names.
All anonymous bets. But does it matter? They're considerably poorer--and wiser--now.
If you're part of the war effort, my bet on the Empire losing looks rosier than ever. Perhaps I'll buy a planet.
Is rewiring a few cameras really so difficult? Think what's at stake.
No, friend, your eyes don't deceive you. I am indeed Hannak Vrish, grand master of the Gilded Descent's gaming tables.
No, friends, your eyes don't deceive you. I am indeed Hannak Vrish, grand master of the Gilded Descent's gaming tables.
But now that the Republic has made the Descent their headquarters, I find myself seeking diversion elsewhere. And this war has provided plenty of opportunities to wager.
How unfeeling.
A master's skills must be honed. Especially in the current climate.
And to better oneself.
Well, before I devote myself entirely to repentance, would you hear a small proposal?
If you want a "diversion," you could defend your world instead of getting rich on its destruction.
How about picking up a rifle?
But I have an obligation to live--for myself, and my admirers. However, that doesn't mean I can't contribute.
Rumor is you brought down a Hutt's business empire in one sabacc game. Took everything he had, right down to his backscratcher.
I've heard of you.
I thought that was a nice touch. But we digress.
How can you literally gamble on people's lives?
You're making bets on the war?
People will die regardless of where I spend my credits. Though, so much death is a waste.
Quite the ego you have.
To deny one's gifts is to deny oneself. But, let us speak of lesser things.
You see, I have a sizeable sum resting on the Empire losing this war. And I dislike having my investments threatened.
The Empire has appropriated several hidden cameras that I installed nearby, years ago. Very unsporting. Especially since, with a little rewiring, those cameras could spy for the Republic.
And help you win your bet.
Well, yes. Why shouldn't patriotism be rewarding?
No one installs hidden cameras without a good reason.
What were these cameras for?
Leverage. Some of my sabacc rivals are rather indiscreet.
Hardwiring the cameras for Republic use should be elementary--though the Empire might have objections. Tread lightly.
Don't think so. [Refuse quest]
Oh. Perhaps your bet lies in the other direction?
Sorry. No autographs today.
